image.altText: A car submerged in water next to a dock.

props.synopsis: A couple celebrating their 57th wedding anniversary have had to be rescued after their car drove off a dock and into the water as they attempted to board a ferry in Tasmania.

title.children: 'Quick thinking' ferry staff praised after couple rescued from car in water

image.altText: A birdseye view of an open-cut mine on the coastline

props.synopsis: A struggling tungsten mine couldn't pay back a $10 million loan as it sat on the brink of administration. So a state government became a shareholder — and issued a new loan.

title.children: How a government has gone 'all in' on a remote island mine with shares and loans

image.altText: Two politicians standing in parliament.

props.synopsis: Recent polling and Saturday's Legislative Council elections highlight problems for the Tasmanian Liberals, as Treasurer Guy Barnett prepares to hand down his first state budget this week.

title.children: Tasmanian government's woes compounded as budget day approaches

image.altText: Exterior signage at Hobart Private Hospital.

props.synopsis: Healthscope's financial situation has prompted concerns about the future of the Hobart Private Hospital, which treats more than 20,000 patients each year.

title.children: Urgent clarity requested on Hobart Private Hospital amid Healthscope woes

image.altText: A woman with dark hair sits at a desk and speaks

props.synopsis: Independent Meg Webb and Labor's Luke Edmunds look set to be returned to their Legislative Council seats. But in Montgomery, it's a race between the retiring member's son and a former senator.

title.children: Two sitting MLCs returned as race continues for third Upper House seat

image.altText: A group of people smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: A 23-year-old Tasmanian wool grader says the healing power of community and daily chores have helped her family through "everything that you could possibly imagine in life".

title.children: Family rocked by tragedies finds strength in country town's support

image.altText: King Penguins with Greg Mortimer from land, Salisbury Plain, South Georgia, Lina Stock @ Divergent Travelers

props.synopsis: A new forecast suggests annual tourist numbers in Antarctica could almost quadruple within a decade, prompting calls for mitigation measures to reduce potential impacts on the continent's sensitive environment.

title.children: Icebergs and 450,000 tourists: The potential scenario facing Antarctica

image.altText: Donald Trump wearing a blue suit and white MAGA hat, standing in front of Air Force One and multiple microphones

props.synopsis: The US President launches a new tirade against Russian President Vladimir Putin over massive drone and missile attacks on the Ukrainian capital, saying he is "needlessly killing a lot of people".

title.children: Trump rages in condemnation of Putin's massive attacks on Kyiv

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired girl in a hoodie cuddles a middle-aged woman from behind.

props.synopsis: Evidence found in Good Night Scrub National Park has been seized for forensic examination, believed to be linked to the disappearance of teenager Pheobe Bishop.

title.children: Evidence found in search believed to be linked to teen's disappearance

image.altText: Parts of the Kempsey district are still under water following record flooding.

props.synopsis: Areas still recovering from last week's record floods are now bracing for gale-force winds, prompting concerns about falling trees.

title.children: 'Dangerous situation' as strong winds forecast for flood-stricken NSW

image.altText: Dozens of shoppers run towards the Northland exits.

props.synopsis: Two teenagers alleged to be the main offenders in a violent brawl between "rival gangs" at a Melbourne shopping centre were on bail at the time.

title.children: Two teens allegedly involved in Melbourne shopping centre brawl were on bail

image.altText: Emergency services at the site of a shooting in parramatta on sunday may 25

props.synopsis: Two men are fighting for life after the third shooting in a fortnight linked to simmering underworld tensions in Sydney.

title.children: Police to swarm Sydney underworld, shooting victim 'not expected to live'

image.altText: A drawn image of a woman being held up by strings on a large hand as though she is a puppet.

props.synopsis: Australia's domestic violence scourge has claimed the lives of 18 women so far this year alone. At its core is coercive control, which is now a standalone criminal offence in two Australian states. But will it be enough to end the violence?

title.children: 'Who did mummy talk to today?' The controlling behaviour at DV's core

image.altText: View looking through soccer goal at Abbeville Park

props.synopsis: A 46-year-old man has been charged after he allegedly grabbed a young boy by the neck at a junior soccer match in Perth's north.

title.children: Man charged for allegedly choking 11-year-old at junior soccer game

image.altText: Aunty Angelique has grey shoulder length hair and is wearing a white and blue top with flowers on it

props.synopsis: Stolen from her family, Angelique Wittwer could only return home and reconnect thanks to a compensation payment. But survivors in other states don't have the same opportunity.

title.children: 'Finally home': Stolen Generations survivor on finding her community

image.altText: Sally Fitzgibbons bending over after a surfing heat

props.synopsis: Sally Fitzgibbons has suffered heartbreak at the Margaret River Pro, losing her round-of-16 match-up in the final seconds, a result which has massive ramifications for the 34-year-old.

title.children: Fitzgibbons downed at Margaret River, with loss carrying major ramifications

image.altText: GettyImages-1531628204

props.synopsis: The protest from Ireland's camogie players refusing to wear traditional skorts mirrors the discussion about whether netballers in Australia should still be mandated to wear skirts.

title.children: After camogie ditch skort requirement, could the netball dress be next?

image.altText: joel cauchi who fatally stabbed six people at bondi junction westfield in 2024 runs thrugh the shopping centre

props.synopsis: In response to the Bondi Junction stabbing attack, the inquest was told the subcontractor used to recruit security staff for Westfield has rolled out new training.

title.children: More rigorous tests for guards seeking work in Westfield Bondi CCTV room

image.altText: Man smiling outside court

props.synopsis: The Independent NSW MP, who maintains his innocence, is accused of sexually assaulting a teen in 2013 and a man in 2015.

title.children: Sexual assault trial of NSW MP Gareth Ward begins in Sydney court

image.altText: A top-down image showing a man's hands resting on the edge of an open Macbook laptop, as anotehr woman's hand points to a screen

props.synopsis: Donald Trump reveals plans to end the United States's Digital Equity Act, which provides funding to programs that assist people to live in an increasingly online world.

title.children: Trump slams 'racist' digital program teaching people to use computers

image.altText: A Starbucks logo is seen at a Starbucks coffee shop in Seoul

props.synopsis: Voters will head to the polls on June 3 following the impeachment of former president Yoon Suk Yeol for briefly declaring martial law in December.

title.children: Why Starbucks just banned these eight names in South Korea

image.altText: The front entrance to the Perth Children's Court.

props.synopsis: A Kalgoorlie-Boulder teenager who stole two cars with children inside as their mothers tried desperately to stop him is sentenced to 15 months behind bars.

title.children: Teen jailed for leaving babies on roadside in extreme heat after stealing car

image.altText: Duop Reath smiles as he walks past a student on an indoor basketball court.

props.synopsis: NBA and Australian Boomers star Duop Reath is on a mission to give back to the community where his basketball journey began.

title.children: 'Anything is possible': NBA star returns to Perth school where it all began

image.altText: Rafael Nadal waves to fans at Roland Garros during a retirement ceremony.

props.synopsis: Fourteen-time French Open winner Rafael Nadal is honoured by the return of Roger Federer, Novak Djokovic and Andy Murray in an emotional ceremony at Roland-Garros.

title.children: 'Couldn't let you leave like that': Big Four reunite to honour Nadal

image.altText: A Darwin Port sign.

props.synopsis: China's ambassador to Australia has fired a warning shot to the Commonwealth over its plans to take back the port of Darwin.

title.children: Chinese ambassador questions ethics of Albanese's Darwin Port plan

image.altText: A politician in a suit and tie speaking inside Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The state government has entered a court appeal with a businessman whose bid to build short-stay units in the Sunshine Coast hinterland failed to win council approval.

title.children: Queensland government backs LNP donor's court battle for luxury units

image.altText: A generic composite image of a transmission tower and a smart meter.

props.synopsis: New South Wales residents will face by far the largest electricity bill increases across the country as the energy regulator releases its final price determination.

title.children: NSW to see largest power price rises as default rates revealed

image.altText: A photo of a river that has broken its banks in Port Fairy with water under a table and chairs.

props.synopsis: The SES prepares sandbags as abnormally high tides threaten to flood low-lying coastal areas across Victoria.

title.children: Victoria's coast on alert amid flood threat from high tides

image.altText: A group of performers on stage with their right arm in the air.

props.synopsis: Olympic breaker Rachael 'Raygun' Gunn tried to shut down a musical about her — now a comedian has worked the legal row into her sold-out new show.

title.children: How a legal stoush with Raygun propelled this comedy musical to success

image.altText: Wind turbines.

props.synopsis: Deputy Premier Jarrod Bleijie has exercised his powers as planning minister to refuse planning approval for the Moonlight Range Wind Farm in Central Queensland.

title.children: $1b wind farm project axed by Queensland government

image.altText: A dead whale lies in the mangroves at Crab Creek.

props.synopsis: Authorities have been unable to determine why 10 melon-headed whales stranded themselves north of Broome earlier this year.

title.children: Rapid decomposition leaves Kimberley whale beachings a mystery

image.altText: Firefighters swim in floodwaters pushing a bamboo raft of six dogs to safety.

props.synopsis: A rescue crew uses Hansel-and-Gretel-style tree markings, a makeshift bamboo raft and a lot of resourcefulness to save two people and six working dogs stranded by floodwaters in New South Wales.

title.children: Bamboo raft used to recover couple and dogs in dramatic flood rescue

image.altText: man walking outside with phone in hand

props.synopsis: A Victorian judge discharges a jury in the trial of ex-AFL player Nick Stevens, after learning she has prosecuted him in a previous case.

title.children: Jury discharged in dishonesty case against ex-AFL player Nick Stevens

image.altText: Canberra Raiders NRL player Joe Tapine speaks to referee Adam Gee as rain falls during a game.

props.synopsis: Canberra coach Ricky Stuart warns against punishing aggression in rugby league as we head into the men's State of Origin series opener on Wednesday night.

title.children: Three Raiders charged as Ricky Stuart issues Origin warning

image.altText: A man in a tan suit and a woman dressed like a nun stare into a cockpit

props.synopsis: The Superbad and Juno star has finally stepped into the Wes Anderson universe... and he immediately steals the show.

title.children: Michael Cera was born to be in a Wes Anderson film
